content:
TITLE: Starting with Activation Key
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to start the environment using an activation key for the Nutrient Document Engine. It requires replacing `YOUR_ACTIVATION_KEY_GOES_HERE` with the actual activation key. Sets the ACTIVATION_KEY environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pspdfkit/pspdfkit-web-examples-catalog/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ ACTIVATION_KEY=YOUR_ACTIVATION_KEY_GOES_HERE docker-compose up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning and Starting the Catalog with Docker
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates cloning the repository and starting the Nutrient Web SDK Examples Catalog using Docker Compose. It assumes Docker is installed and configured. This will start the catalog in trial mode.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pspdfkit/pspdfkit-web-examples-catalog/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ git clone https://github.com/PSPDFKit/pspdfkit-web-examples-catalog.git
$ cd pspdfkit-web-examples-catalog
$ docker-compose up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Resetting and Starting with Activation Key
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates resetting the environment and then starting it again with the activation key. Replace `YOUR_ACTIVATION_KEY_GOES_HERE` with the actual activation key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pspdfkit/pspdfkit-web-examples-catalog/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ docker-compose down --volumes
$ ACTIVATION_KEY=YOUR_ACTIVATION_KEY_GOES_HERE docker-compose up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Resetting and Starting with Activation Key on Windows
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to reset the environment, then sets the activation key environment variable in Windows, and finally starts the environment. Replace `YOUR_ACTIVATION_KEY_GOES_HERE` with the correct value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pspdfkit/pspdfkit-web-examples-catalog/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ SET "ACTIVATION_KEY=YOUR_ACTIVATION_KEY_GOES_HERE"
$ docker-compose up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting with Activation Key on Windows
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set the activation key environment variable in Windows before starting the environment with Docker Compose. Replace `YOUR_ACTIVATION_KEY_GOES_HERE` with your actual activation key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pspdfkit/pspdfkit-web-examples-catalog/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ SET "ACTIVATION_KEY=YOUR_ACTIVATION_KEY_GOES_HERE"
$ docker-compose up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Resetting the Environment with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to reset the environment by tearing down the containers and volumes, and then recreating them using Docker Compose.  This will remove all persistent data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pspdfkit/pspdfkit-web-examples-catalog/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ docker-compose down --volumes
$ docker-compose up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Tearing Down Docker Containers and Volumes
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to tear down all Docker containers and volumes associated with the project. This is useful for resetting the environment and removing any persistent data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pspdfkit/pspdfkit-web-examples-catalog/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker-compose down --volumes
```
